review_title: Pleasant place to work with exceptional benefits
job_title: Director of Human Resources in Chicago, IL
pros:
Near North is a pleasant place to work with great benefits.
The providers at Near North are great, many of whom have been there for years, they have a passion for serving the under served and provide care with a purpose.  If you are looking for a place that is Mission driven Near North is the place to fulfill your personal goals.
cons: Sometimes the work can be challenging, but if you keep the Mission at the forefront of your work it makes it easier to get from point A to point Z

review_title: Will not recommend to experience nurses and ma

review_title: This is a solid entry level job
pros: BCBS insurance, flexible schedule and hour lunches
cons: Terrible base pay, supplies are limited for work

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Chicago, IL
pros: Higher pay for LPN, Entry level job for new nurses
cons: Lpn work is glorified MA work, administration is so UNPROFESSIONAL. It’s like a high school, and they do play favorites.

pros: you have benefits and some money

pros: Caring for the underserved, growing clinical skills.
cons: Poor management, poor communication and favoritism.

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Chicago, IL
pros: I have been a part of the NNHSC family for almost 2yrs now and I must say that I have enjoyed the opportunity given to join this family. Near North is truly my home away from home, and my second family. This is a place that you can get your career started and also grow within the organization. It's like any other work place with it's ups and downs, but overall it's warm, friendly, and caring...it's definitely an organization worth joining and referring for quality health care. NNHSC takes great pride in the work it does in the communities in which it serves, for over 51 years the quality of care has been consistent, as patients have demonstrated that by remaining loyal and many have built relationships with the staff and providers at the various sites. I am eternally grateful and humbled for the opportunity I received 16 months ago to join this family and I remind myself that NNHSC didn't have to chose me, but I am glad they did and for that I give my absolute best and more to show my continued appreciation. I do all that I do because I love what I do here and I genuinely care about the people at NNHSC.
cons: It's not an actual con, but wishful thinking...I wish HR could have summer hours on Fridays or casual Friday every Friday.

review_title: Could be a fantastic place to work BUT......
pros: The mission of the organization to serve the underserved is awesome and needed in the communities where their centers are located
cons: Turn-over is extremely high.  Senior management runs the place like a crime sydicate. If you say anything  they don't like they will intimidate you until you leave on your own or until they round up enough unfounded proof to fire you.  They set unattainable goals system wide and expect you to not only reach them but to supercede them but don't give the support or resources needed to do so.

job_title: Human Resources Director in Chicago, IL
pros: Near North Health Service is very Mission driven.  Its leadership is very dedicated to ensuring the health and wellbeing of the patient population that we serve.  Management participates in periodic needs assessments to ensure they know what the needs are in the communities.  Management is also very sensitive regarding its employees dedicating l/2 day/month to ensure staff is educated on issues facing Near North and providing training to ensure staff are competent to provide the highest level of care to our patients.
cons: Some staff with self serving agenda's.  There is gossip everywhere, it is up to you whether you participate in foolishness or rise above it.

pros: This company is dedicated to the health and wellbeing of its communities.  If everyone at Near North took the Mission to heart, it would be a great place to work.  The Executive leadership live and breath the Mission.  Mrs. Thomas is an exceptional visionary.
cons: negative people permeate the workforce, they infect new staff with their negative dispositions and that affects everyone's ability to work harmoniously.

review_title: Great company to work for with many cultures to embrace and work with.
pros:
Management is actively involved with employees throughout the department.  Great place to learn cohesion, adaptation and how to overcome professional skill gaps. 
Opportunity to  be involved in various events  to carry out the mission  of the organization.
Ample holiday, sick and vacation time.
Great Health Insurance and Retirement Benefits.
cons: Not enough exposure for such a great company. More people should know who this company is and the services they provide to society.

review_title: A long-standing institution of quality healthcare in Chicago.
pros: Working at Near North provides a foundation for learning, contribution new ideas, and establishing longevity.  These are just a few of the characteristics which go towards serving our patients.  Near North has a number of locations around the city, which make accessibility easy.
cons: We could probably improve the way we share our story of who are and what we do.

review_title: A dark cloud in the Healthcare industry
pros: I worked with a great team & met some fantastic people. Working for Near North will force you to take a serious look at yourself, your faith and what you require from your workplace to be satisfied. You will leave here with a clearer sense of what you will and will NOT accept in a job and from your manager. Sometimes you kiss a few toads before you find your prince. This place is the toad and you will never have a better sense of your level of professionalism when you experience the virtual opposite here. You will also find out your worth. You'll either say to yourself, 'I'm better than this. I'm out of here.' Or you'll say, 'I've got to get better so I can get out of here.' Either way, you'll do some soul searching and that can be a good thing.
cons: A fish rots from the head and senior management is as rotten as can be. If you're a well-networked professional,  get ready to feel conflicted about alerting your contacts that you work at Near North. As your colleagues are meeting for lunch, traveling for conferences,  forming partnerships, gaining industry knowledge and making deals, you'll essentially be chained to your desk with no power, no autonomy and lucky if they approve your order for business cards. Are you used to directing strategy and affecting change or putting your degree to use? Well, hold on to how gratifying that feels -You won't be doing any of that at Near North. Are you used to being at the table as a mover/shaker in your industry? Near North is not at any of those tables and has 0 interest in such things.  Check out other progressive FQHCs and the projects they're involved in. THEN, attempt to have a critical conversation on strategy with your E.D. You'll walk away - mind blown. And get ready to have your mind blown once again by the fact that you'll be punching in and out and 'talked to' if you attempt to leave before 5pm. You'll feel like you're back working at Denny's again.

job_title: Substance Abuse Team Leader in Chicago, IL
pros: They supply a service for many who need it.
cons: I was given three days training to take over the position of a man who had run the program for 27yrs, Sad to say he died of cancer. Without turning into a book, let me just say that for that amount of work I was to do and figure out on my own due to lack of training, I was then told I was responsible for bringing in the clients. I was NOT told this at my interview 4th day and beginning of a full week at my new office at Windfield-Moody Health Care, I went to my office and never saw another face again - not even my supervisor.  Nobody stopped by my office despite my door being open to say "HI" or ask how I was doing; if I needed anything. Things I consider common courtesy. When I was discharged after being given 2 weeks to figure everything after 3 days of training (half of which was commuting from 43rd & Berkeley to Winfield-Moody, the only reason my supervisor gave me was "It's just not a good fit."

pros: Great mission, truly vital services, working for people too often marginalized and almost always grateful. Opportunity to see and feel mission on a daily basis.
cons: A toxic culture breeds some of the most miserable, argumentative, hypocritical, and paranoid people with whom you'll ever have the misfortune to work. Not one coworker was ever happy.

review_title: Great first job, difficult to move up.
pros: Great first job between degree and dietetic internship. A lot of training available and I would try to grab every opportunity to learn something new.
cons: Difficult to move up. Only 2 other positions above WIC Nutritionist job - WIC Coordinator and Director of Nutrition Services.

review_title: Working at NNHSC has been very rewarding.   The company is very Mission driven and puts the needs of patients first.
pros: You can grow in your role.
cons: Everyone is not Mission driven.

pros: Learning environment, Generous benefits, training opportunities, knowledgeable staff, supportive leadership
cons: Need increased visibility, flexible work hours, remote work opportunities, regulated temperatures in the buildings, company sponsored employee recognition dinner.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Cicero, IL
pros: love the providers who i worked with and the nurses where awesome!
cons: favoritism. overworked and low pay.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Chicago, IL
pros: Great hours, loved the patients.
cons: Pay was terrible and way less than market.

pros: Very friendly staff, hard working, and dedicated to the cause of serving the underserved
cons: I plead the 5th.  upper management needs better people management skills

review_title: Just a quick review of my job

review_title: Work here as a last resort

pros: There are no good reasons to work here
cons: The management is horrible, the clinics are dirty, the turnover is high.  This is the worst place I have ever worked for.
